result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus O Arias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1-15CM91, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 (includes DNA surcharge), due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 5/19/15 and on the 19th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, which may transfer to Waukesha or another county as long there is no expense to Jefferson County taxpayers or the Sheriff. 

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus O Arias

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement

Cases 15CM91, 15CT58 & 15CT167 called together at 10:27 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jesus O Arias in court with Attorney Michael Reyes. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sylvie Dahnert sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
15CM91 & 15CT167: Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CM91 & Count #1-15CT167; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered knowkingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses outright Case 15CT58

On Count #1-15CM91, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 (includes DNA surcharge), due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 5/19/15 and on the 19th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, which may transfer to Waukesha or another county as long there is no expense to Jefferson County taxpayers or the Sheriff. 
0 days credit

On Count #1-15CT167, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25 + costs = $484.50 (includes DNA surcharge), due in $50 incriments per month, beginning 5/19/15 and on the 19th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 10 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, which may transfer to Waukesha or another county as long there is no expense to Jefferson County taxpayers or the Sheriff. 
3 demerit points assessed
No suspension of driving privileges
0 days credit
Recess: 10:57 am
